Tech News

End-to-End Encrypted Email Providers Also See Sign-Ups Surge as Chat App Users Flock to Signal and Telegram in Search of Privacy

After Facebook announced changes to the terms and conditions of its popular chat app, users searching for greater data privacy protections are turning to alternative apps and encrypted email providers.

Signal and Telegram Are Also Growing in China – for Now

Despite the Chinese government’s propensity for digital censorship policies, certain chat apps presently remain available in China, either through the App Store or through more creative means.

The Tech That Was Fixed in 2020 and the Tech That Still Needs Fixing

The tech world experienced many highs and lows in 2020, including advances in video chat, fitness tech, and electric scooters but problems with delivery apps and foldable phones.

YouTube Launches Hashtag Landing Pages to All Users

“Hashtag landing pages,” which are dedicated spaces featuring only videos using a particular hashtag, may change how users and creators leverage hashtags on YouTube.

SEO News

Google Explains Why Sites With Some SEO Bad Practices Rank Well

Google uses multiple algorithms to rank sites, such that search engine rankings are essentially a balancing act considering various factors designed to focus on the overall value of a website.

How Do I Change my Google My Business Logo?

Changing your logo on your Google My Business profile may be just as simple as updating your cover photo on the Google My Business website.

Google URL Inspection Tool Now Displays Multiple Referring Pages

A recent update to Google Search Console allows users to view multiple sources used by Google to discover your URL, as opposed to a single source.

Google's Thoughts On Selling Domains Based On SEO Value

According to certain Google employees, buying used domains based on their SEO footprint is similar to buying a car based on a topped-off gas tank.

Google Posts No Longer Expire After Seven Days

Google Posts, which allow businesses to communicate with customers through their Google My Business listings, are appearing in the Knowledge Panel beyond the previous expiration window.

Schema.org vs Google Structured Data Rich Results

If you use structured data that is published on Schema.org and also listed on the Google developer site, you can benefit by showing up with richer search results in Google Search.

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews

Featured Lawyer

Tanya Freeman

RED BANK, NJ

Justia Lawyer Rating and Reviews is a system designed for lawyers to provide valuable insight from peers and colleagues personally familiar with the lawyer’s work.

Lawyers who have received reviews will have a badge on their profile showing their Justia Lawyer Rating, a numerical representation of the reviews they have received. Our research shows that the Justia Lawyer Rating Badge is the most used search filter in the Justia Lawyer Directory.

Don’t miss out on your chance to showcase your Justia Lawyer Rating Badge on your websites, blogs, and other properties!
Read More

Social Media News

TikTok’s New Q&A Feature Lets Creators Respond to Fan Questions Using Text or Video

Select creators on TikTok have been granted access to a new Q&A feature that allows creators to more easily engage with fans through video and during live streams.

Pinterest Tests New Stories Panel at the Top of User Feeds

Pinterest has rolled out a new “Story Pins” feature, creating a new means of social engagement that highlights the stories of Pinners whom you follow.

TikTok Provides New Video Overview of How to Set Up a TikTok Ad Campaign

TikTok has created resources about TikTok Ad Campaigns that will aid business users looking to use the app as part of their strategic outreach and promotion efforts.

Facebook Rival MeWe Gains 2.5M Members in a Week as Users Seek Privacy

The ad-free social network MeWe continues to report rapid growth, as social media users search for a way to safeguard their online data from third parties.

Legal Industry News

Tales of Double-Crossing, Big Egos and Cattle Brands Swirl Around Gerry Spence Lawsuits

Multiple lawsuits stemming from a 2020 organizational split of the Trial Lawyers College have pitted the legendary attorney Gerry Spence against board members in both state and federal courts.

Over 1,000 New Lawyers Get Licenses Without Taking Bar Exam

As a response to the COVID-19 pandemic, several state bar associations granted emergency diploma privilege to recent law school graduates to allow them to start practicing law.

Tip of the Month

Let Clients Know You Offer Video Chat & Conferencing

To help individuals and businesses find lawyers who do video conferencing, we have added a new "Offers Video Chat" filter to our Justia Lawyer Directory search. There will also be a "Video Chat & Conferencing" badge on your profile and in the listing pages. This lets visitors easily find lawyers who offer video chat and conferencing services.

Offering video chat and conferencing can make interactions more personal and provide a better client experience. We encourage every lawyer to update their profile and select the video services that they offer. If you do not currently offer video chat or conferencing services, you can start now!
Update profile now

Free Law Firm Webinar with Tim Stanley

Wolf, Esq. and moderator John F. Romano, Esq. Topics discussed included Grass Root Marketing, Lawyer Directories, Google My Business, SEO, and Reputation Management, among others.

JurisPro Expert Witness Directory

JurisPro provides a free directory of expert witnesses in over 10,000 areas of expertise.

Insurance Adjuster Expert Witness Testimony Not Allowed in Trademark Infringement Case

An Insurance Adjuster Expert Witness was not allowed to testify on likelihood of confusion between products as no testing was performed.

Automotive Expert Witness Allowed to Testify on Commercial Truck Standards

An Automotive Expert Witness could provide testimony on commercial trucking standards, but could not offer legal conclusions.

Emergency Medicine Expert Witness Allowed to Testify on Distribution of Controlled Substances

An Emergency Medicine Expert Witness was allowed to testify as to whether oxycodone caused a death.

Cybersecurity Expert Witness Testimony Allowed in Data-Breach Lawsuit

Cybersecurity Expert Witness, who was a forensic accountant, was allowed to opine in a bank data breach case.

Learn how to research experts here: JurisPro Expert Witness White Paper
